oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena

Class GraphOracleSem

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphBase
      • oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena.OracleGraphBase
        • oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena.GraphOracleSem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.jena.graph.Graph, org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphWithPerform

    public class GraphOracleSem
extends OracleGraphBase
    An implementation of Jena Graph interface that works with Oracle RDBMS 11g semantic storage. Each instance of this class will have a corresponding backend Oracle RDF/OWL/SKOS model and a corresponding application table (with a column of type SDO_RDF_TRIPLE_S). Inserts/deletes performed through method calls OracleGraphBase.performAdd(Triple) or OracleGraphBase.performDelete(Triple) will be translated to insert or delete statements against the associated application table.

    A single database connection will be used behind the scenes to handle all JDBC calls. For performance reasons, changes made through method calls OracleGraphBase.performAdd(Triple) or OracleGraphBase.performDelete(Triple) will not be committed immediately. One can explicitly commit all the changes through OracleGraphBase.commitTransaction(), or commit will be called automatically when OracleGraphBase.close() is executed.

    Starting from this new Jena Adaptor version, the default application table will be created using "basic compression." It helps performance and reduces storage consumption. Note that if a GraphOracleSem object is created against an Oracle model containing Quads, then the graph name values of quads will be ignored. This may affect results of GraphBase.size() and OracleGraphBase.graphBaseFind(Triple).
    Since:
    2007

      Returns the graph name which is always NULL for GraphOracleSem objects.

      Drops and the re-creates the RDF/OWL/SKOS model and the corresponding application table.

      Remove all data from the current GraphOracleSem object and its underlying RDF/OWL/SKOS model persistently.

                      boolean nologging)
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Constructs a new instance.
        Parameters:
        context - information about the underlying oracle database objects to use
        erase - if true, existing model is to be dropped
        nologging - if true, then add NOLOGGING when creating the application table, if the application table is absent.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error for database related operations.

        public GraphOracleSem(Oracle oracle,
                      java.lang.String modelName)
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Constructs a new GraphOracleSem instance without erasing existing data. If absent, the application table will be created using NOLOGGING for better performance (less robust).
        Parameters:
        oracle - the oracle connection wrapper object. See Oracle for details.
        modelName - the name of the backend RDF/OWL/SKOS model
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error for database related operations.

      • GraphOracleSem

        public GraphOracleSem(Oracle oracle,
                      java.lang.String modelName,
                      Attachment attachment)
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Constructs a new instance without erasing existing data. The application table will be created using NOLOGGING for better performance (less robust), if needs to be created.
        Parameters:
        oracle - the oracle connection wrapper. See Oracle for details.
        modelName - the name of the backend RDF/OWL/SKOS model
        attachment - an Attachment object that is used to specify additional backend RDF/OWL/SKOS models and/or rulebases. Those additional models and/or rulebases specified will affect the query and inference.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error for DDL, DML, query execution, or connection setup.

      • GraphOracleSem

        public GraphOracleSem(Oracle oracle,
                      java.lang.String modelName,
                      boolean erase,
                      boolean batchMode,
                      boolean blankNodeFidel)
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Constructs a new instance. The application table name, rules index name, and namespace prefix mapping table name will be upper case of modelName appended by "_TPL", "_RI", and "_NS" respectively. If absent, the application table will be created using NOLOGGING for better performance (less robust).
        Parameters:
        oracle - the oracle connection wrapper object. See Oracle for details.
        modelName - the name of the backend RDF/OWL/SKOS model.
        batchMode - specifies whether JDBC batch will be used to speed up add/delete operations.
        blankNodeFidel - if set to true, will preserve blank node in its original form during query. Note it is not feasible to preserve the original form if there are multiple models involved ( through Attachment).
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error for database related operations.

      • GraphOracleSem

        public GraphOracleSem(Oracle oracle,
                      java.lang.String modelName,
                      boolean erase,
                      boolean batchMode,
                      boolean blankNodeFidel,
                      Attachment attachment)
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Constructs a new instance. The application table name and rules index name will be uppercase of modelName appended by "_TPL" and "_RI", respectively. If absent, the application table will be created using NOLOGGING for better performance (less robust).
        Parameters:
        oracle - the oracle connection wrapper object. See Oracle for details.
        modelName - the name of the backend RDF/OWL/SKOS model
        batchMode - specifies whether JDBC batch will be used to speed up add/delete operations
        blankNodeFidel - if set to true, will preserve blank node in its original form during query. Note it is not feasible to preserve original form if there are multiple models involved ( through Attachment).
        attachment - an Attachment object that is used to specify additional backend RDF/OWL/SKOS models and/or rulebases. Those additional models and/or rulebases specified will affect the query and inference.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error for database related operations.

        Parameters:
        oracle - the oracle connection wrapper object. See Oracle for details.
        modelName - the name of the backend RDF/OWL/SKOS model
        erase - indicates whether existing model should be removed first.
        networkOwner - the owner of the network tables/views. If null default MDSYS is used.
        networkName - the semantic network name
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error for DDL, DML, query execution, or connection setup.

      • GraphOracleSem

        public GraphOracleSem(Oracle oracle,
                      java.lang.String modelName,
                      java.lang.String networkOwner,
                      java.lang.String networkName)
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Constructs a new GraphOracleSem instance without erasing existing data. If absent, the application table will be created using NOLOGGING for better performance (less robust).
        Parameters:
        oracle - the oracle connection wrapper object. See Oracle for details.
        modelName - the name of the backend RDF/OWL/SKOS model
        networkOwner - the owner of the network tables/views. If null default MDSYS is used.
        networkName - the semantic network name
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error for database related operations.

      • GraphOracleSem

        public GraphOracleSem(Oracle oracle,
                      java.lang.String modelName,
                      java.lang.String tableName,
                      java.lang.String ruleIndexName,
                      java.lang.String prefixMappingTableName,
                      boolean erase,
                      boolean batchMode,
                      boolean nologging,
                      boolean blankNodeFidel,
                      Attachment attachment,
                      boolean useVirtualModel,
                      java.lang.String vmName)
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Constructs a new instance.
        Parameters:
        oracle - the oracle connection wrapper object. See Oracle for details.
        modelName - the name of the backend RDF/OWL/SKOS model
        tableName - the name of the application table
        ruleIndexName - the name of the rules index to be generated, if inference is to be involved
        prefixMappingTableName - the name of the prefix mapping table
        erase - if true, existing model is to be dropped
        batchMode - specifies whether JDBC batch will be used to speed up add/delete operations.
        nologging - if true, then add NOLOGGING when creating the application table, if the application table is absent.
        blankNodeFidel - if set to true, will preserve blank node in its original form during query. Note it is not feasible to preserve the original form if there are multiple models involved ( through Attachment).
        attachment - an Attachment object that is used to specify additional backend RDF/OWL/SKOS models and/or rulebases. Those additional models and/or rulebases specified will affect the query and inference.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error for database related operations.

    • Method Detail

      • analyze

        public void analyze()
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Collects statistics using default parameters for this graph. Behind the scenes, Oracle database will invoke DBMS_STATS package and collect statistics for this graph (Oracle RDF/OWL/SKOS model).

        It is very important that up-to-date statistics be maintained for a graph to ensure efficient execution of query and inference. The SQL Optimizer needs accurate information to choose a good execution plan.

        After a significant amount of change has been done to a graph, this method should be invoked. Notice that however, statistics collection is a time/resource consuming process, so only run it when necessary.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error generated from DBMS_STATS package.

      • analyze

        public void analyze(float estimatePercent,
                    java.lang.String methodOpt)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Collects statistics for this graph. Behind the scenes, Oracle database will invoke DBMS_STATS package and collect statistics for the underlying Oracle RDF/OWL/SKOS model of this graph.

        It is very important that up-to-date statistics be maintained for a graph to ensure efficient execution of query and inference. The SQL Optimizer needs accurate information to choose a good execution plan.

        After a significant amount of change has been done to a graph, this method should be invoked. Notice that however, statistics collection is a time/resource consuming process, so only run it when necessary.

        See Oracle documentation "PL/SQL Packages and Types Reference" for detailed explanations of the parameters.
        Parameters:
        estimatePercent - has a valid range of [0.000001,100].
        methodOpt - A typical value for methodOpt is "FOR ALL COLUMNS SIZE AUTO."
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error generated from DBMS_STATS package.

      • analyze

        public void analyze(float estimatePercent,
                    java.lang.String methodOpt,
                    int dop)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Collects statistics for this graph. Behind the scenes, Oracle database will invoke DBMS_STATS package and collect statistics for the underlying Oracle RDF/OWL/SKOS model of this graph.

        It is very important that up-to-date statistics be maintained for a graph to ensure efficient execution of query and inference. The SQL Optimizer needs accurate information to choose a good execution plan.

        After a significant amount of change has been done to a graph, this method should be invoked. Notice that however, statistics collection is a time/resource consuming process, so only run it when necessary.

        See Oracle documentation "PL/SQL Packages and Types Reference" for detailed explanations of the parameters.
        Parameters:
        estimatePercent - has a valid range of [0.000001,100].
        methodOpt - A typical value for methodOpt is "FOR ALL COLUMNS SIZE AUTO."
        dop - degree of parallelism. Note that on a balanced hardware setup, running this method with a dop > 1 can significantly shorten the statistics calculation time.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error generated from DBMS_STATS package.

      • analyzeInferredGraph

        public void analyzeInferredGraph()
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Collects statistics for the inferred graph that is derived from this current graph and the attached models and rulebases. Behind the scenes, Oracle database will invoke the DBMS_STATS package and collect statistics for inferred data.

        It is very important that up-to-date statistics be maintained for a graph to ensure efficient execution of query and inference. The SQL Optimizer needs accurate information to choose a good execution plan.

        After a OracleGraphBase.performInference() call is done, this method should be invoked.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error generated from DBMS_STATS package.

      • analyzeInferredGraph

                                 java.lang.String methodOpt)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException

        After a performInference call is done, this method should be invoked.

        See the "Oracle Database PL/SQL Packages and Types Reference" for detailed explanations of the parameters.

      • clearRepository

        public void clearRepository()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Remove all triples from this GraphOracleSem object. Note that the underlying implementation of this API has changed. Application table is no longer dropped and re-created. Instead, a DDL (truncate) is used to remove all triples.
        Specified by:
        clearRepository in class OracleGraphBase
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • createTables

        public void createTables()
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates the corresponding application table and the underlying RDF/OWL/SKOS model of this graph object. A proper database index will be created on the application table. Also, a prefix mapping table will be created. The prefix mapping table will have the following two columns, prefix of type VARCHAR2(50) and namespace of type VARCHAR2(4000).

        Note: This method will ignore errors which report that the tables, RDF/OWL/SKOS model, or indexes already exist. This provides a robust means to initialize an RDF/OWL/SKOS model that is in an indeterminate state, such as from an error during an earlier operation.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error during DDL operations.

      • dropTables

        public void dropTables()
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Drops the underlying RDF model, any indexes, any rulebase indexes, and the corresponding application table.

        Note: This is robust to errors reporting that a named object does not exist, and will continue to drop any named objects that are part of the repository, in order to clean up partially instantiated repositories.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is any error code other than ORA-13199: Model does not exist. ORA-00942: table or view does not exist will cause a SQLException to be thrown.

      • getGraphName

        public java.lang.String getGraphName()
        Returns the graph name which is always NULL for GraphOracleSem objects.
        Specified by:
        getGraphName in class OracleGraphBase

      • getGraphNode

        public org.apache.jena.graph.Node getGraphNode()
        Returns a NULL as the graph node.
        Specified by:
        getGraphNode in class OracleGraphBase

      • graphBaseFindSubjectObject

        public org.apache.jena.util.iterator.ExtendedIterator graphBaseFindSubjectObject(org.apache.jena.graph.Node[] predicates,
                                                                                 org.apache.jena.sparql.engine.ExecutionContext ctxt)
        This method returns an object of type ExtendedIterator that contains answers to the query. Answers consist of triples that have predicates specified in the Node object array.
        Overrides:
        graphBaseFindSubjectObject in class OracleGraphBase
        Parameters:
        predicates - an array of Nodes for all possible predicates. It must be an array of URIs.
        Throws:
        org.apache.jena.shared.JenaException - when there is any SQLException generated from the underlying SQL execution.

      • rebuildRepository

        public void rebuildRepository()
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Drops and the re-creates the RDF/OWL/SKOS model and the corresponding application table. This method implements the same logic as the clearRepository API in Jena Adaptor v2.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • removeAll

        public void removeAll()
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Remove all data from the current GraphOracleSem object and its underlying RDF/OWL/SKOS model persistently. Behind the scenes, a DDL (truncate) is executed so there is no way to rollback.
        Overrides:
        removeAll in class OracleGraphBase
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
